paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses various mutations in the TTR gene associated with transthyretin amyloid polyneuropathy (ATTR-PN), detailing their clinical significance, patient demographics, and penetrance data.

patients.demographics: 41 patients with ATTR-PN, mean age 50.3 ± 13.3 years, 30 males and 11 females

individual_records.evidence_sentence: All patients had TTR gene mutation, with Val30Met in thirteen.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met mutation is the most common pathogenic variant overall.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The Val30Met mutation is particularly noted for its high prevalence in ATTR-PN.
key_quotes: The TTR Val30Met mutation is the most common pathogenic variant overall.

patients.demographics: 41 patients with ATTR-PN, mean age 50.3 ± 13.3 years, 30 males and 11 females

individual_records.evidence_sentence: All patients had TTR gene mutation, with Val30Leu in four.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Leu mutation is associated with ATTR-PN.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The Val30Leu mutation is less common than Val30Met but still significant.
key_quotes: All patients had TTR gene mutation, with Val30Leu in four.

patients.demographics: 41 patients with ATTR-PN, mean age 50.3 ± 13.3 years, 30 males and 11 females

individual_records.evidence_sentence: All patients had TTR gene mutation, with Ala97Ser in three.

functional_data.summary: The Ala97Ser mutation is associated with ATTR-PN.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The Ala97Ser mutation is less common than Val30Met and Val30Leu.
key_quotes: All patients had TTR gene mutation, with Ala97Ser in three.

tables_processed.table_caption: Clinical and pathologic findings of subgroups in ATTR-PN.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant variants in the TTR gene were extracted successfully.
